description: News and reaction to the impact of coronavirus on Jersey and other top stories.
title: Coronavirus: Jersey news and virus updates 20-24 July
title_page: Coronavirus: Jersey news and virus updates 20-24 July - BBC News
maintext:
Dr Ivan Muscat, Jersey's deputy medical officer of health, said there will be "significant improvement" on the time it takes to get results from coronavirus testing.
Speaking to BBC Radio Jersey about efforts to ramp up PCR or swab testing on the island, he said his department is "trying to improve efficiency of both the transport system and the IT system for feeding back results not just to Jersey but then to the individuals concerned".
Getty Images Copyright: Getty Images
On-island and at scale testing is also being brought in, which Dr Muscat said will allow the processing of 1,300 tests every eight hours.
As there would be two or more shifts a day, there would be an average of 2,600 tests a day with a turn-around time that could be as little as five to six hours, he said.
The result will go out electronically "there and then" in what Dr Muscat called a "significant improvement on where we are".
